comment: An excellent and creative solution using an alternative method (stochastic dominance). The core mathematical steps — defining random variables, calculating their CDFs, and proving the required inequalities between them — are all correct. A point was deducted for a conceptual error in stating the resulting dominance relationships, even though the final conclusion was derived correctly from the established CDF inequalities.
types_of_mistakes: Conceptual error: The solution correctly proves the required inequalities between the cumulative distribution functions (e.g., F_X ≤ F_Y) but then incorrectly states the resulting stochastic dominance relationships (i.e., it claims X dominates Y, when in fact Y dominates X).
